newsitem.title: INDIA: CRICKET-ADAMS' CAREER-BEST HAUL RESTRICTS INDIA.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-ADAMS' CAREER-BEST HAUL RESTRICTS INDIA.

text.p: Left-arm spinner Paul Adams bagged a career-best haul of six wickets for 55 runs as South Africa bowled out India for 237 in the first innings on the second day of the third and final cricket test on Monday.
At lunch, South Africa were 34 for the loss of Andrew Hudson, who was out lbw to a flipper from legspinner Anil Kumble for 15.
Gary Kirsten on 18 and Herschelle Gibbs, who was yet to score, were at the crease.
Adams, playing only his fifth test, added three wickets on Monday to the middle-order scalps he claimed on Sunday.
He dismissed captain Sachin Tendulkar, Aashish Kapoor and Javagal Srinath, after skipper Hansie Cronje bowled Kumble with an in-cutter.
Tendulkar, who made 61, hit Adams for three quick boundaries before mistiming a lofted shot to Fanie de Villiers at cover.
Kapoor was caught by De Villiers in the covers for 11 and Srinath fell without scoring to a brilliant diving return catch by Adams.
